metadata.title: Build Settings Page UI (Profile/Hours/Services/Staff/Notification Preferences)
metadata.prd_reference: Feature 6 Clinic Settings + user bento/drawer guidance

context.background: This task implements Build Settings Page UI (Profile/Hours/Services/Staff/Notification Preferences) for Healio and is scoped as one atomic work item aligned to the PRD. It should be completed within 45 mins and leave clear evidence for follow-on tasks.

design_constraints.constraint: Use Stripe-like frictionless workflows: create/edit actions should open centered modals or slide-out drawers instead of disruptive full-page forms.
Use a Viedoc-style bento layout: soft floating white cards on an off-white background for dashboards and dense data views.
Apply the Paper Replacement palette: app background near #F9FAFB, white cards, calm trustworthy accents (teal/sage/cerulean), and reserve red for critical alerts only.
Preserve high-legibility typography: clean sans-serif (Inter/SF Pro/Halyard), bold patient names, slate-gray secondary metadata.
Honor the one-click rule where applicable: keep the global + action for Add Appointment, Add Patient, and Create Invoice visible and easy to reach.
Add educational empty states with clear CTAs for first-time or empty datasets.

instruction.step: Implement the scoped changes for Build Settings Page UI (Profile/Hours/Services/Staff/Notification Preferences) in the planned files (healio/app/(dashboard)/settings/page.tsx, healio/components/settings/clinic-profile-card.tsx, healio/components/settings/operating-hours-card.tsx, healio/components/settings/services-manager-card.tsx ...) while preserving the PRD-aligned project structure.
Apply validation, error handling, and consistent response/UI behavior so the task output integrates cleanly with existing helpers and patterns.
Wire integrations and dependencies for this task (endpoints: GET /api/v1/clinics, GET /api/v1/services, GET /api/v1/staff) and keep tenant scoping/RBAC/security expectations intact where applicable.
Prefer in-context modal/drawer workflows, scannable bento cards, and educational empty states so the UI matches the requested Healio experience.
Verify keyboard/focus behavior, touch target sizing, and mobile responsiveness before marking the task ready.

validation_checklist.check: Exercise the related endpoint(s): GET /api/v1/clinics, GET /api/v1/services, GET /api/v1/staff and verify response shape/status codes.
Run lint/typecheck or the smallest relevant test suite for the files changed by this task.
Manually verify desktop and mobile layouts plus focus/keyboard behavior for the primary interaction path.
Use Chrome DevTools MCP to verify the implemented UI in-browser (desktop + mobile), check interactions, inspect console errors, and capture a validation snapshot before marking done.
Capture a screenshot or short note confirming empty/loading/error states are present where applicable.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: The deliverable for Build Settings Page UI (Profile/Hours/Services/Staff/Notification Preferences) is implemented in the referenced files and compiles without breaking adjacent modules.
Task output matches the PRD scope (Feature 6 Clinic Settings + user bento/drawer guidance) and remains bounded to an atomic <=45-minute implementation chunk.
Related endpoint behavior returns the standard success/error envelope and respects auth/public route expectations for the route class.
UI states (loading, empty, error, success) are present and visually consistent with Healio bento cards, off-white background, and trust-oriented styling.
Interactions are keyboard accessible and usable on mobile without disruptive navigation when a modal/drawer workflow is appropriate.

execution_tracking.verification_command: npm run typecheck; Chrome DevTools MCP on http://localhost:4012/settings (desktop/mobile interactions, console/network checks)
execution_tracking.verification_notes: Implemented settings bento workspace UI with clinic profile, operating hours, services, staff, and notification preference cards backed by existing settings APIs. Verified Stripe-style in-context drawer flows (profile/hours/preferences), keyboard Escape close behavior, mobile layout, and fixed a runtime checkbox handler bug found during MCP validation by capturing `checked` before the state updater callback.

evidence.item: When work starts/completes, record changed files, test commands, screenshots (UI tasks), and commit/PR references here.
Endpoint verification via UI/network: `GET /api/v1/clinics`, `GET /api/v1/services?includeInactive=true`, and `GET /api/v1/staff` all returned `200` and populated the corresponding bento cards.
Chrome DevTools MCP (desktop): verified `/settings` renders with bento cards, opened `Edit Profile` and `Edit Hours` drawers, and confirmed `Escape` closes drawers while preserving page context.
Chrome DevTools MCP (notification prefs): opened `Edit Preferences`, toggled the `1-hour SMS reminders` checkbox, clicked `Save Draft`, observed drawer close and success toast (`Saved locally`).
Chrome DevTools MCP (mobile 390x844): verified stacked card layout, mobile navigation visibility, and profile drawer open/close behavior without layout breakage.
Console check: `list_console_messages` returned no console messages after reload/fix. Network check: `list_network_requests` showed successful page/assets loads plus settings API `200` responses.

Runtime bug fix during verification: resolved `TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'checked')` in notification checkbox handler by capturing `e.currentTarget.checked` before `setNotificationPrefs` updater.
Feature commit: 6e0c501 (feat(healio): settings page bento ui).
Include Chrome DevTools MCP evidence (snapshot/screenshot reference and notes on responsive + interaction checks) here before marking frontend tasks complete.
